content: The Java Integer class wraps the primitive type int in an object. An Integer Class object contains one field of the type int. The Integer class contains a variety of other methods to help with converting int values or dealing with the int type in general.
fields:
[{"name":"BYTES","type":"static final int ","description":"The number of bytes used to represent an int value in two's complement binary form.
"},{"name":"MAX_VALUE","type":"static final int","description":"A constant that holds the maximum value that an int can have, (2^31)-1."},{"name":"MIN_VALUE","type":"static final int ","description":"A constant that holds the minimum value that an int can have, -2^31."},{"name":"SIZE","type":"static final int ","description":"The number of bits used to represent an int value in *two's complement binary form*. 

Two's complement is a way of representing integers, see (https://www.cs.cornell.edu/~tomf/notes/cps104/twoscomp.html).
"},{"name":"TYPE","type":"static final Class<Integer>","description":"the Class instance that represents the primitive type int"}]
name: Integer

methods.name: intValue
methods.content: Part of the Integer class within the java.lang package that returns the value of the Integer as an int.

methods.name: parseInt
methods.content: This method returns an integer value from a String input that is a decimal equivalent.

methods.name: Integer
methods.content: new Integer(int value) is the constructor for the Integer class. It will return an Integer object with the value "int value".
methods.parameters: [{"name":"value","type":"int","description":"parameter is the value to be represented by the new Integer object. Note: the parameter can also be a parseable String."}]
